titleInfo.title: Issue of The Knoxville News-Sentinel, dated August 6, 1945

mods.abstract: Issue of the Knoxville News-Sentinel, a newspaper based in Knoxville, Tennessee. This issue was published on the day that the United States dropped the first nuclear bomb in Hiroshima, Japan. Of special note is the headline article, "Atomic Super-Bomb, Made at Oak Ridge, Strikes Japan," which describes the detonation of the "Little Boy" atomic bomb in Hiroshima and the development of the nuclear weapon by the Manhattan Project and Clinton Engineer Works.
